snippet: The governor of New Jersey said on Facebook that he was ending his presidential campaign, a day after he came in a disappointing sixth in the primary.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie ends his 2016 presidential run following sixth-place finish in New Hampshire, where his campaign focused most of its efforts; Christie orchestrated takedown of Marco Rubio at preceding debate, act that benefited other Republicans but not Christie personally.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: The governor of New Jersey said on Facebook that he was ending his presidential campaign, a day after he came in a disappointing sixth in the primary.

headline.main: Chris Christie Drops Out of Presidential Race After New Hampshire Flop
headline.print_headline: Christie Ends Campaign After Poor Finish in Primary
